page.description: The a5w_report_saveas() method prints LayoutName to file in PDF, HTML, RTF, or TXT formats. If no format is specified, the PDF format is used. If a report needs to get access to global variables defined in a .a5w page, you must call this function, and not Report.SaveAs()
page.syntax: Result as C = a5w_report_saveAs(C LayoutName [,C Saveas_format [,C Filter [,C Order [,C Filename [,P globalVariables [,* PrintOptions [,* Arguments [,* Options ]]]]]]]])

argument.name: Saveas_format
argument.description: Character, type of tile to create (PDF/Excel/HTML/RTF/Text)

argument.name: Filter
argument.description: Filter expression to apply to report. Character

argument.name: Order
argument.description: Order expression to apply to report detail.

description.p: A pointer to the global variables. See explanation below.

argument.name: PrintOptions
argument.description: PDF Driver options. See [Report.SaveAs()] for more details.

argument.name: Arguments
argument.description: Optional SQL Arguments (if required by the report datasource). See [Report.SaveAs()] for more details.

page.discussion: The *[xb:a5w_report_saveas]* function generates a Report from the Application Server.

section.title: Global Variables in Web Applications

description.p: In a desktop application, global variables are accessible throughout the application. Passing a pointer to the global variables is not necessary.

In a web application, global variables are variables defined on on the .a5w page and exist for the duration of the page. They are not accessible to other .a5w pages. You can use the [global_variables() method] to create a pointer to the global variables defined in an .a5w page

section.example: dim globalvars as p globalvars = global_variables() globalvars.userName = "John Smith"

section.description: If you have global variables that are used by the report, you must create and pass the global variable to the *[xb:a5w_report_saveas]* method in a web application.
section.example:
dim globalvars as p globalvars = global_variables() globalvars.myglobal1 = "foo"
dim layout_name as c layout_name = context.request.applicationRoot + "/customerList.a5rpt"
a5w_report_saveAs(layout_name,"PDF","","","c:\data\custlist.pdf",globalvars)
